private_information: I can move disks A B C D (A is smallest, D is largest among those).
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is reached: left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom A, right peg top-to-bottom B C.

private_information: I can move disks E F G (E smallest among them, G largest).
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is reached: left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom A, right peg top-to-bottom B C.

private_information: I can move disks H I J (H smallest among them, J largest).
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is reached: left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom A, right peg top-to-bottom B C.

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and integrate their proposed move sequences.
I will produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver, keeping agents' actions distinct.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move proposals into a valid joint plan and output a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that encodes the moves and constraints.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with three pegs named left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A B C D E F G H I J with A the smallest and J the largest.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G H I J.
Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Only one disk can be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.
Agents have disk-moving permissions: agent_1 moves A B C D, agent_2 moves E F G, agent_3 moves H I J.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 responsible for moving disks A B C D. Propose a sequence of primitive moves that respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions.
propose_moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg1 and peg2 are one of left, middle, right. Only include moves for disks A B C D. Ensure every move is legal: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Base your sequence on the public information about the initial and goal configurations and your private permissions. Do not output PDDL.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 responsible for moving disks E F G. Propose a sequence of primitive moves that respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions.
propose_moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg1 and peg2 are one of left, middle, right. Only include moves for disks E F G. Ensure every move is legal: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Base your sequence on the public information about the initial and goal configurations and your private permissions. Do not output PDDL.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 responsible for moving disks H I J. Propose a sequence of primitive moves that respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions.
propose_moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg1 and peg2 are one of left, middle, right. Only include moves for disks H I J. Ensure every move is legal: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Base your sequence on the public information about the initial and goal configurations and your private permissions. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You must integrate agents' move lists into a single coherent PDDL domain and problem that preserves agent action identities and encodes the Tower of Hanoi rules.
pddl.prompt: You will receive three ordered lists of primitive moves from agents. Your task is to validate and integrate them into a single joint plan and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Keep each agent's moves as distinct action schemas or named actions so that the plan records which agent performed each move. Enforce legality constraints: one disk moved at a time, cannot place larger disk on smaller disk, and only allowed agents move their permitted disks. If you detect conflicts or illegal moves in the agents' proposals, resolve them by adjusting ordering while preserving legality and agent permissions. Output a PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and a PDDL problem enclosed between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should represent pegs left middle right, disks A..J with appropriate size ordering, agent-specific move actions, and a goal encoding the required final configuration: left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom A, right peg top-to-bottom B C.
